CustomField.inlineHelpText: The dog should not be restrained when handled, allow them to move away if they choose to do so. Begin by touching their chest, cheek and shoulder, then move to back, feet (if safe to do so) and ears and mouth. Finally, lure the dog into a harness (this can be done at any time in the assessment). Stop immediately if handler feels unsafe. Use food as required.
CustomField.label: Basic Handling - Behaviour

value.fullName: Relaxed/compliant: soft body posture, may seek information or remain calm and engaged
value.label: Relaxed/compliant: soft body posture, may seek information or remain calm and engaged

value.fullName: Appeasing: body/face tension, some displacement may roll over, or freeze/slow, shake off, lean
value.label: Appeasing: body/face tension, some displacement may roll over, or freeze/slow, shake off, lean

value.fullName: Fearful/Anxious: avoids/retreats, may increase movement, panting, drooling, mouthing, vocalising, high displacement
value.label: Fearful/Anxious: avoids/retreats, may increase movement, panting, drooling, mouthing, vocalising, high displacement

value.fullName: Over stimulated: high arousal, may begin to mouth, jump up, body barge, behaviour feels unsafe
value.label: Over stimulated: high arousal, may begin to mouth, jump up, body barge, behaviour feels unsafe

value.label: Freeze/conflict: may show whale eye, displacement, handler feels unsafe, assessment stopped
